intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Welcome to the Cheve Underground. This is where the resistance meets. We should be safe here for the time being.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Ryoma. I think I speak for everyone when I say this... We're so glad to have you back in command.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: We all missed you so much!

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: I knew you'd be fine. But I'm still glad to have you back.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Now that we're all reunited, nothing can stop us!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Thank you, everyone. It's great to see you all again. And I must apologize for making you all worry so much. To think of all you've overcome to track me down... I've never been prouder to be your older brother.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So, what's next? Now that we're all back together, it seems like anything is possible.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: I like the sound of that. So you all must be Ryoma's siblings, right?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Ah, yes. It seems introductions are in order.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: These are my younger brothers, Corrin and Takumi. And my sisters, Hinoka, Azura, and Sakura.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: This is my younger brother, Takumi. And my sisters, Hinoka, Azura, Corrin, and Sakura.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Everyone, this is Scarlet.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: Wait...those names are awfully familiar. Are you named after the Hoshidan royal family?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Er. You could say that. We ARE the Hoshidan royal family.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: Urk! Please forgive me, Your Highness! I had no idea you were THE Ryoma!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Please, Scarlet. You may simply call me Lord Ryoma. I apologize for not revealing my true identity earlier, but it was necessary. I wanted to get a true feel for your group without my royalty muddying the waters.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: You needn't have worried. We have a common enemy. And many of us have strong ties to Hoshido. My own grandfather was one of the king's servants many years ago.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Is that so?

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: Yes! I've always wanted to be a knight because of him. I fact, if it wouldn't be out of place...I'd really like to join your party. You've seen what I can do in battle. What do you say?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I say we'd be lucky to have you. Welcome aboard.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: Yes! Thank you so much, Lord Ryoma.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ryoma, can you tell us more about the resistance?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Yes. The group here in Cheve is one of the most well organized. In the early stages of battle, I learned of this group and decided to investigate. I made my way to this region and joined the resistance under false pretenses. Of course, you must realize that there are underground anti-Hoshido groups as well. That's why it's important for us to have a presence in regions controlled by Nohr. In case the conflict spreads.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: I can't believe I didn't recognize him. Oh well. I'm just glad we're on the same side. All of us in the Cheve resistance simply wish to be free of Nohr's oppressive rule.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes. It's important to remember that we're not just fighting for Hoshido. Garon's mania for conquest must not be allowed to claim one nation more!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What was that? I thought this was a safe house.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: It is! Nobody outside the resistance knows about this place. Let's see what's going on.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: What's going on? What was that blast?

intro.speaker: Resistance
intro.line: Milady, we're surrounded by Nohrian troops. Our men have engaged the enemy, but we're severely outnumbered.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: No! How did they know that we were here?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: We may still have a traitor among us...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What are you suggesting? You saw what happened to Zola.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I don't know, Corrin. How else could this have happened?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I refuse to believe...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: No matter. We must evacuate immediately. There's a secret path nearby. Come, everyone!

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: But what then? That path leads right to Nohr's doorstep.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Indeed. And that is exactly where I intend to go.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: Are you serious? We're not ready for that kind of mission.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Running from the enemy won't bring this war to an end. We need to confront King Garon directly. And I believe that a swift counterattack would be the last thing he expects now. What do you think, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I think you're right. Moving forward quickly with a small force could actually work.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: I don't know...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Scarlet, if you're not on board with this plan, please don't feel obligated to join. I understand it must be hard to leave your troops here to fend for themselves.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: No...I'll go with you. The resistance here is strong. We may be outnumbered, but we'll win the day. I can see the conviction in your eyes. Let's do this!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Excellent. Now that we're in agreement, we should get moving. The sooner we make our move, the greater our advantage!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So this path leads all the way to Nohr? Are you sure we'll be safe?

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: We should be. Then again, I thought that our safe house was actually SAFE. We built the path for this exact purpose, but I had no idea we'd use it this soon...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm sorry, Scarlet. Our arrival has certainly set things in motion.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: It's all right. Maybe it's just the spark we needed to finally make a move. So please, wipe that sad look of your face. We're going to kick some butt!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Whoa! Thanks, I guess I needed that. If we're going to invade Nohr all by ourselves, I'd better be confident.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: We're close, everyone. Time to get serious.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, that's a formidable wall. And there's no shortage of troops... Everyone, please listen up. Once we cross the border, there's no turning back. If anyone wants to retreat, now's your chance. You will not be judged.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: I'll follow you to the end of the world, Corrin. You have my support.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: And leave you here to take on these jerks all by yourself? Forget about it. I'll bend my bow to your will, Corrin!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I wouldn't think of staying behind after all you've done for us.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I'm pleased to see you taking on the role of a leader, Corrin. You're becoming worthy of the sword that has chosen you. Naturally, I will not be turning back.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: You know this already, but you have my support as well, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, everyone. Your support means the world to me. Now, let's head into Nohr and show King Garon we mean business!

boss.speaker: Benny
boss.line: Nothing personal. I'll make it quick...

boss.speaker: Benny
boss.line: I did my best. That's all I can say...

boss.speaker: Charlotte
boss.line: Ugh, I have better things to do. Why'd you have to invade today?

boss.speaker: Daniela
boss.line: How sad for you to make it all the way here only to be butchered by me!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: We made it! Did that really just happen?

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Yes, Corrin. We won this battle. But remember, we're in Nohrian territory now. We've got a long way to go.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Can't I just be happy for a minute?

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Of course. But time is of the essence. Garon will hear about this soon. It won't be long before more Nohrian troops are on our trail.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: He's right. We've got to find someplace to rest. It'll be dark soon. There's cover in the forest nearby. What do you think, Ryoma?

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: I think that's a good idea. Let's move toward the forest. I've been studying maps of the area in preparation for this scenario. Follow me!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ugh...I can't get any sleep. If only I could shut off my brain for a few hours... What's that?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Ugh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ah, it's Azura. I wonder what she's doing up at this hour. I hope everything's OK. It almost seemed like she was going to faint back in Nestra. Well, there's only one way to find out.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Where'd she go? I can hear her voice... It sounds like she's singing that song again.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: You are the ocean's gray waves... ♪

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ah, there she is. It seems a bit cold for a swim...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Oh, Corrin!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura...what are you doing out here? Couldn't sleep?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Were you following me?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I suppose I was. I just heard your voice, and I wanted to ask you something.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes? What is it?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well, it's about the song you were singing just now.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I see.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What can you tell me about it? It seems to have a different effect on everyone. For example, when you sang to Takumi, it seemed to break the spell he was under. But when you sang to the Nohrian soldiers, it was almost like they were in a trance. And Izana knew some of the words—even though he'd never heard it sung before! How is that possible?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I'm sorry, but I'd rather not talk about it.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Really? Azura, it's me. You can tell me anything.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: You should try and get some sleep. We're going to be up early tomorrow.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Please don't change the subject. You won't talk about the song, and I feel as though I hardly know anything about you. Doesn't that make you lonely? You know that we're all friends—we're here for you!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Corrin...it's not that simple... Ugh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura! What's wrong? How can I help?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Agghhh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No! Azura!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Don't look...at me...please.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What's happening to you?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: *huff *huff* *huff* Phew... I'm OK now. I'm sorry to have worried you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Please, don't apologize. I'll go get someone. Can Sakura help?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I'm afraid not. What you've seen is the result of a curse. Like you, I carry special blood in my veins. But this comes at a price... I can sing for fun, or even to help someone in battle, and I'll be OK. But when I sing THAT song, in combination with my pendant... I'm able to generate a special kind of power.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: The power to exorcise demons?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Something like that. But in exchange, every time I use the power, I suffer. It doesn't always happen right away. But it always happens.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Why didn't you tell us before? You've been suffering needlessly this whole time!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: No. The suffering is temporary, and I always recover.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: But nothing. Each time I have sung that song, it was required. And it will be required again in the near future. We will eventually need the song's power to defeat King Garon.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I see.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Please don't worry. Although it is excruciating, the pain always subsides. If my song can help us end the war, I'll sing it as many times as necessary.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: OK. But you must promise that you won't ever put yourself in danger. I don't know how you can willingly inflict such suffering upon yourself...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I promise. If only everyone were as kindhearted as you, we'd have no war at all, Corrin.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Azura.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I'm sorry for no telling you about this before, but... I didn't want you to worry. Remember, you mustn't hesitate to have me use the song if it becomes necessary.
